body: The budget here is **30 mins**, which is exactly how much time will be paid for, when the task is completed
@mits0908 can you please help? Keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here

Code already have Unit test for GhMarkdown is GhMarkdownITCase.
Or where i should create Mockito test for GhMarkdown ?

@mits0908 Yes, but this `GhMarkdownITCase` is an integration test, not a unit test. It works only against a live Github server. When you run it with `mvn clean install` it will be ignored. That's the difference between unit and integration tests. In this ticket we should create a unit test, where `Request` will be mocked, either using Mockito or `com.rexsl.test.request.FakeRequest` (up to you).
OK, i see. In which package should i create this unit test class ? and do we have any name conventions ?
It is my first time and therefore a lot of questions :)

Questions are very welcome (btw, see http://www.tpc2.com/dev/faq). Put it into the same package where the class is: `com.jcabi.github`. It should be named `GhMarkdownTest`. Pay attention how other classes are named and located. Ask, if you're in doubt! Don't assume anything, always ask.

BTW.
My Intellij IDEA fails to compile project on the IssueLabelsTest class - Matchers.allOf (line 67).
After comment lines 65-71 all is working.

Hm.. strange. Works for me (IDEA 12.1.6, Java 1.7). Btw, if you see a bug in a project (like this one), submit a new issue. First, you will get paid for it. Second, it will be properly fixed and the code will be improved. You will do good :)

1. "File does not end with a newline" - ignore them, they only happen on Windows
2. Write it like this: `@todo #32:10min`
3. All classes should be ordered alphabetically
4. Make the entire class `final (see how it's done with other tests)

The same "@todo tag has wrong format" with "\* @todo #32:10min add verification ..."
Other were fixed.
Submit a pull request, I'll review. Difficult to say without the code.

I did pull request and moved this issue to fixed.
I spent a lot of time on this first commit :) Hope, all is ok.
@mits0908 shall I review the pull request? Is it ready?

yes.
As i understand, you have already reviewed it.
I did commit several minutes ago with new version of file.
